name: 세종대왕
summary: Sejong (Korean: 세종; 15 May 1397 – 8 April 1450), widely known as Sejong the Great (세종대왕; 世宗大王; Sejong Daewang), was the fourth ruler of the Korean state Joseon and the inventor of the native Korean alphabet Hangul. Today, Sejong is regarded as one of the greatest leaders in Korean history.

events.event_description: Sejong created and promulgated the Korean alphabet, known as Hangul, in an attempt to increase literacy and as a complement to the logographic Sino-Korean Hanja.
After Sejong's death, the compilation of the Samguk Sagi, a historical record of the Three Kingdoms of Korea, was completed.
